With that said, I am concerned I am being used as a rebound, or as a temporary means to comfort her. She ended her engagement a few months ago with her ex of 4 years (they were engaged for 1 year).

I didn't find out they were engaged until I looked at her Facebook page and where she still has dozens of photos of them together and all her friends congratulating her on the engagement. I found this odd because she had talked about him alot but intentionally hid the fact that they were engaged, only ever referring to him as her "ex boyfriend". I asked her why she never told me and her response was that "she didn't want to scare me away". Her ex bought a dog with her, so they take turns sharing the dog for a week. So they are still in touch with each other and she still talks to his parents about logistical things as well. 

I have no problem with her talking to her ex fiance about logistics, because we aren't in an exclusive relationship. However, this girl keeps telling me how much she likes me, but when I asked her what she thought "about us" she sounded confused and responded "well... I like hanging out with you" which was strange considering how much she professes her feelings for me. I like this girl alot. My concern is that I'm a rebound and she will ditch me when she gets bored or finds someone better. Should I be concerned about anything here or am I overthinking?

prompt:
Any success stories on difficult introductions? I'd love to hear how you guys managed it!

*Background*

We used to have 2 6-year old cats who were litter mates. They got along fine, though the girl cat would occasionally growl at the male cat. She'd sometimes be chased by him but would end up later sleeping on each other.

Our male cat suddenly died, and a month later, we've adopted a 4 year old male from the shelter. We've kept him in a separate room for 7 days so he could acclimate. He's very playful and affectionate.

On the 8th day, we swapped rooms with the cats, so the girl cat could get used to the new cat's smells, and the new cat could explore the rest of the house. That went fine.

Later on we opened the door and let them see each other. There was immediate hissing/growling from the girl cat. I understand this is probably normal. I was giving the girl cat a lot of affection in front of the new cat, so it didn't feel threatened. That seemed to work. 

Every time the new cat moves around the room, the girl cat gets extremely aggressive. Even though i've prevented most of it. There's been a couple of times when the girl cat has chased the new cat and has made contact (lots of fur flying).

We've had the cats separated again so they can both relax. Now when I open the door, the girl cat comes in, and always looks to want to attack the new cat. 

The new cat, who was previously ambivalent to the other cat (even through growls), is now starting to show fear around the girl cat :(
chosen: Our older girl cat is growly and hissy, and wants to attack the new cat all the time. The new cat is starting to get scared around the girl cat.
rejected: New cat was initially hostile to the first cat. It started to calm down. Now the new cat is starting to show fear around the first cat. How do I fix this?

prompt:
Me and my fiancee are planning to get married soon, but only recently we decided to talk about money. I am 27 and she is 28. I'm in a solid and secure job as a teacher, and I earn fairly well. She is just beginning her masters degree, and is expecting to get a scholarship soon. If she starts receiving this scholarship, she will earn a little less than 1/3 of what I earn.

I understand that when you get married, both incomes become the couple's income. But I'm a little upset, and I told her, that she had in mind that we would get married, and she'd only be responsible for part of the expenses, as in I would have to pay for more stuff than her.

She has this kind of annoying way of creating facts out of small examples. For instance, she mentioned this friend of hers that got married with insecure sources of income, and the marriage is working. Also this other friend, whose salary summed with her husband's salary is not a lot, but things work. In her mind, if two or three couples that she knows are married and (apparently) well, then our marriage is gonna work.

We went through a list of expenses we would have together, and reached a conclusion that our incomes summed up wouldn't be enough. That's because I would then be responsible for my expenses and her expenses, with just a little financial help of part of her income.

Although she acknowledged that I was right about not being able to get married at the moment, she said she was sad, because she would only be able to work in her area after at least two years. She still says that she hasn't changed her mind, and she believes that with our income together, we can work it out. I am worried about our conflicting opinions.

What do you think, is it possible to estimate what is a good income to get married? What problems different incomes can bring to the couple? What do you think about the general situation?
chosen: Me and my fiancee are thinking about getting married, but we have different opinions about marriage and finances.
rejected: I earn more than my fiancee, but only because we're getting married soon. To get married, we have to get married, but she thinks we could work it out if we combine our incomes.

prompt:
I just went on a first date with a girl I met on a dating site. We're both fairly geeky online types who are into a lot of the same things and think very similarly to the point where we could easily be best friends. But I don't find myself head-over-heels with her, and that irks me.

For someone that I clicked with so well, shouldn't I be infatuated with her, and eager to spend as much time as possible with her? We did set up a second date for later this week, and I'm looking forward to it, but part of me feels like we're going to be very good friends.

It's important to mention that I'm very inexperienced with this dating thing. I've never actually gone on more than three dates with someone, and even those times were fraught with peril. I've gone on more first dates, but I always found myself enamored with her presence or incredibly anxious to sleep with her.

I'm not itching to jump into bed with this girl, even though she's incredibly attractive (at least a whole point higher than me on the attractiveness scale, and I consider myself slightly above average). I'm not dying to spend every waking moment with her. I don't consider myself unworthy of her presence, nor do I feel filled with the desire to make her the happiest person alive when she's around me. (These all being things I've felt in my previous, ultrashort "relationships".) The entire trip home I've been thinking about how I want this to work out, but I have no idea (and *should* have no idea) whether I'd ever want to marry her.

Is this how normal people think when they start healthy relationships that they want to last? I mean, I realize much of my change in behavior is learning from past mistakes, but I'm seriously put off by my lack of infatuation here. Shouldn't you be infatuated with the people you date? All I feel for her at this point is "like."

Reading this over, this sounds like a troll. It's not. I actually feel quite pathetic about asking this, but if I had a therapist I'd've probably asked them first.
chosen: I feel like I've become a "normal" person because I don't want to spend all my time with a girl I'm dating and don't feel a strong desire to be with her. Is this normal?
rejected: I'm a virgin and I'm getting seriously insecure about being unable to get up the courage to sleep with a girl I've been seeing for a few weeks. I feel like I'm a jerk for being this way, but I don't know whether I'm just being crazy or if this is common.

As I was bringing the cursor over to the back button I noticed that the first image in the folder was a girl I went to school with in a bikini, we're not friends so to speak but we knew each other, and my boyfriend knows we went to school together because I told him that when she sent him a friend request on facebook about a year ago, I'm pretty sure he just though she looked hot in the photo or something, but at the same time I'm a little weirded out that he has a photo of someone I kind of know on his phone, yet as far as I know no photos of his girlfriend (which up until this point I'd never really thought about or cared about, he sees me naked every day anyway).

I'm thinking about asking him about it (I will tell him how I found it) and if maybe he could delete it because it's making me feel weird, but I just want some clarification that I'm not being a psycho hose beast or anything by feeling creeped out by this.
chosen: Found a photo of my friend on my boyfriend's phone, I have no idea if it's creepy or not, what do?
rejected: I found my bf's phone pics of a girl I went to school with in a bikini, wondering if I'm being weirded out that he has a photo of someone I kind of know on his phone.

prompt:
This is the letter I plan to read to him when he wakes up:

I have been bottling up a lot of things right now because I feel it is more important to support you during this difficult transition into your new career. However, if I do not say something soon, I will hate you.

I am upset at the messes around the house that you leave. 

I re-homed the dress collection so that you would have the space you need to organize your belongings in the office closet. However, the office is a mess and your possessions are all over the dining room table and in the entryway. 

I day dream about someday having my dream home. I get incredibly sad when I think about the chance that it will never happen. Until I can move, I have to live here. I try to make the best of it by making the house look nice but I cant when your mess is all over the place. You need to not clutter the shared living spaces.  When you are done eating, you need to throw the garage and recycling away and clean up the things left out in the kitchen.

I work very long shifts and whenever I get a break I find that I am the only one doing the dishes, laundry, vacuuming, shopping, and cooking. I want you to be an equal in participating in the chores. 

I feel over whelmed by the amount of possessions that you have. I feel that my house is used as your storage space. Every expensive new luxury steals a little piece of our future home away. I fear planning for the future is being left just for me.

I need there to be change. Or I will break up with your and you will need to leave.
chosen: I am going to complain to my boyfriend about his messes and lack of ability to clean up.
rejected: I am going to tell my boyfriend that his messy and unnecessary office and living spaces are not expected of me and will make me unhappy. I want to give him a note saying that I am upset and that I am going to leave.

prompt:

Friendship length : 3 years

We had a great relationship (at least I thought so). He is the kind of guy who claims he's a natural flirt (should have been my red flag) and I was always arguing with him about that because to me, there is a difference in being friendly and actively flirting/leading girls on. But he talked well and always argued back and making me feel like the one who was wrong. I also caught him in many lies yet he still managed to talk his way out.

Then I found out from another girl(F/18) that he had been cheating on me with her. He apparently had a whole other secret relationship with her, telling her to keep it a secret from me and badmouthing me so she wouldnt ever talk to me. She didn't believe what he said about me, so she came to talk to me instead. We confronted him and he tried to lie his way out again. I showed him the proof I had and he came clean, but I had to prod and pry him out of all the details. Turns out it wasnt just one girl he had been cheating on me with.

This time, he was extremely sorry, kept begging for another chance and gave me all his email passwords, instant messaging passwords and allowed me to check on his computer/phone any time I wanted. He gave me a long, detailed explanation on why he did those things and wanted to seek professional help. After 2 weeks of thinking about it, I decided to give him a chance.

But now I resent him in everything he does. The things he says or does, I don't believe him one bit. He has not shown any sign of cheating, and he has stopped flirting with anyone, pretty much being a good person. I don't know how to break up with him now, or how to bring it up. On top of that, I also feel very vengeful, but I know it would be immature to exert revenge of any kind. But I also don't like feeling that he would get away without any consequence.

rejected: I (F/22) cheated, I took him (M/23/INFP) back, now I feel resentful towards him and he is also resentful towards me.

prompt:
As the title says, my boyfriend is so lazy when it comes to cleaning and tidying up after himself. I'm not particularly a clean freak either, but he is so oblivious to stuff that needs done. He will leave empty bottles/food wrappers on his table for days without moving them, then gets grumpy when I ask if he's ever gonna move them. I'll put a load of laundry on then hang it up to try and the clothes will literally sit there for a week until he thinks to put them away, or actually, he won't fold them away and he'll just wear them off the airer. It's so lazy! He'll come home from work, change our of the clothes he wore and will just leave them lying on the bed then complain that they're crushed or smelly. 

I used to tidy up after him because I hate seeing shit lying around everywhere. But I've stopped because I cba anymore and he's old enough to do it himself. I asked him if he could just look around the house to see if anything needs tidied or cleaned and he said he "just doesn't notice these things". I said that's not really an excuse - he's 25 and hasn't lived at home for years now, so he needs to, you know, start actually noticing these things. 

I used to nag him A LOT but I've stopped doing it. I'll tidy up my own stuff, do my own laundry and put my clothes away. It's not my fault if on Sunday night he can't find any clothes to wear to work because he didn't do his washing. But I don't really want it to be that way. I want him to notice these things and start taking some pride in his house. He's not even a messy person as such and he's very particular about some things so I'm sure he can get better with tidying up. What do you suggest?

prompt:
We rescued Chimichanga from our local shelter 2 years ago.  He was a year old.  He was dying from ghiardia after having it for several months without treatment.

We spent the next 2.5 years training him.  He's a crazy lab/greyhound mix so it was near impossible... but we did it.  I wouldn't say he's my best friend, but he's a pretty cool guy.

Yesterday, he got out of our yard and killed our neighbor's dog.. A little 4 pound yorkie.  He broke its legs and ripped its stomach open.  It was still alive when they brought it to the vet and they put it down.

Chimi came home, but animal control was called.  They agreed to let us put him down ourselves if we can provide proof that it is done before Friday.  I have to work then, so we're going first thing tomorrow morning to do it...

I feel absolutely terrible for the poor yorkie... We've already agreed to cover their vet bill and the neighbors are being surprisingly understanding about the whole thing.  If it were me, I'd've grabbed a crowbar and killed the attacking dog on the spot and want to sue his owner for all their worth.  I know it doesn't work like that... dogs are considered property by the law but, to me, they're family.  I know Chimi just thought the dog was probably a rabbit and he went into chase&kill mode... He does that with snakes in our yard... He's a very sweet dog to people, though, and everyone in the neighborhood knows how friendly he is... and he was part of our family for close to 3 years now, actually.  I'll miss him.
chosen: My dog accidentally killed the neighbor's dog and animal control is forcing us to euthanize him.**
rejected: My dog killed a dog in our yard and it's my last day in this world.

prompt:
Happened a few years back, when I was 10 yrs or so.

I had moved to the Middle East, due to my Dad getting transferred here, and lived in a flat-type system. I only had 1 or 2 friends since no one else in the building was around my age. We all became really good friends after some time since we had some things in common.

To the actual fuck-up now. Being small, I was always curious about one thing or the other, which got the good of me.

My Dad and Mom were going out for regular shopping and all, and I decided to stay back with my friend at my place. As my Dad was in a hurry a bit, he forgot to take a 20 Dinar note he had kept in the shelf along side his wallet, he obviously took his wallet but didn't notice the note kept along side it since he was in a hurry.

Now that piece of money got me really intrigued, I always wondered what if I could get that cash and keep it all to myself! Imagine the things I could do! Me being the little 10 yr old bitch, excuse my self from my friend for a bit, and silently keep the note in my pocket. Mind you it was 20 Dinar(Bahrain's Currency), which is a lot of money.

My Dad is mostly particular about money and when he comes back, he searches for the note in the shelf. He asks my Mom if she knows where it was but to no avail. I literally turned into a pussy lol and was shivering to death inside. I didn't have the guts to spill it out. My Dad kept on thinking maybe he spent somewhere and what not but he eventually gave up.

Remember the note is still in my pants and I completely forgot about it that night and slept off. The next day, it's laundry time, my pockets are checked by Mom always because I tend to keep chocolate wrappers and whatnot in my pockets. 

Gone. Mom finds the note. Tells about it to Dad. Both call me in the living room. Got a superb lecture about it. Cried like an asshole. But hey, learnt my lesson and I haven't lied about stuff from then on. Or have I? loljk
chosen: TIFU by lying about a 20 Dinar note in my pants and Mom finds it out. Got a lecture for it.
rejected: Don't lie to your parents. Even if you are hiding something, just say it fucking right now! There's no point in hiding something till you get fucked up!

prompt:
About a year ago I saw a picture of a girl on /r/realgirls and learned her name in the comments. She has a bunch of pictures all over the internet of her from about 18 to mid twenties. None of these pics are nudes, they are just her posting to social media throughout her daily life. She's insanely beautiful. She's my dream girl. 

One day I was bored so I looked her up on Facebook. I saw some information about her personal life that attracted me to her even more. The feeling grew deeper and I started thinking about her more often. 

Recently I sorta went looking for more pictures of her and found some I'd never seen. When I found them it was like a punch in the gut. I don't know how to explain it. I was sweating and dizzy. I am literally having physical reactions seeing more pictures of his girl. 

Now I can't stop thinking about her. What's she's doing? I hope she's okay. I know this is really unhealthy. When I wake up to take a piss in the night I'm thinking about her. I'm battling myself trying to find ways to STOP THINKING ABOUT HER. 

I know I've constructed a fantasy that isn't real, but it feels real. I get sinking feelings in my stomach when I think of her. I want her out of my head. I don't know what the fuck happened to my brain. I feel sad about the fact that we don't know each other.
chosen: I'm obsessed with a girl I saw pictures of online. It is starting to feel unhealthy and making me sad in life. Do I need to talk to a psychiatrist?
rejected: what's wrong with me? I've fallen in love with a girl I've never met and I don't know how to stop it.

prompt:
Didn't know where else to ask this. 

Wedding is in the summer of this year.

I was going to surprise her by playing and singing "Thinking Out Loud" by Ed Sheeran where gradually everyone from the wedding party is playing an instrument and/or singing as backup singers as I told her it'd be "our song" when Ed's album first dropped, but  she found a few videos of me that I recorded for practice and saw the devastation on my face. My reaction along with certain "hints" as I'd been, **extremely** subtly, relaying the message that playing that song at weddings is overdone made her realize what those videos were for and made her tear up a little. I told her I wouldn't do it anymore because the surprise was ruined. I figured I'd do it anyway because she wasn't aware of the rest of the wedding party joining in, but now I'm wondering if it'll be a nice surprise/"better" to write her a song and perform it with the same idea of having the wedding party join in. 

Is this too cheesy? I started writing, but then started getting all these thoughts of how cheesy this is and how it might be *too* cheesy for everyone at the wedding.
chosen: Is it bad to make the bride cry in a good way? (makeup, etc.) Is it cheesy to write a song and play it for her as a surprise?
rejected: Will I be too cheesy by writing a song for my bride to sing at her wedding and have her not know about it until the day of?

prompt:
My boyfriend and I have been together for 6 months, and he's never cheated on me or anything like that. In fact, our relationship is pretty great, he's my best friend and we love all the same video games. Anyways, I stumbled across pictures of all his ex-girlfriend's nakedness yesterday and it's been really bumming me out, how do I fix this sad feeling?    

I know it's stupid, I also found porn and that didn't bother me at all, I mean, everyone loves porn (even me, especially me haha). But seeing pictures of his ex-gf's all nakey really did bother me, maybe because all of them have sexier/skinnier bodies than I do, or maybe just because he kept them?    

I haven't told him I found the pictures or anything, I feel guilty that I found them at all (note to all the girls out there, if you are looking for an image that you downloaded onto your boyfriend's laptop, never, ever type "jpg" in the start menu search bar and press enter...)    

Anyhow, it occurred to me this morning (as my bf was accusing a girl at his work of being too fat), maybe he's just a shallow guy? in fact, he's never called beautiful, all I've ever gotten from him is, "you're sexy" or "you're hot." I just don't see how I could ever build a romantic, long-term relationship with a guy like this...    

Ohh well, I'm still trying to figure it out, do you have any advice for me?
chosen: found nakey pics of bf's ex-gfs on his laptop and now i feel sad, how do i undo this sad feeling? pls help
rejected: Stumbled across very sexy pictures of my boyfriend's ex-girlfriends on his laptop, I feel so sad now, how do I unsee what I saw? How do I fix this relationship?

prompt:
Advice is a form of nostalgia (so they say!)  

Earlier last week I was taking some casual photos (relevant) at an event with some friends, and I met this girl (24ish) through a mutual friend that was there. Towards the end of the evening, we had a nice conversation that continued all the way up to walking to her car. Just some basic, what-do-you-do/where-are-you-from stuff, but damn, she intrigued the hell out of me. 

I was seriously on the very edge of asking her if she wanted to grab coffee sometime, but alas, I chickened out and we said bye without exchanging numbers or anything. I really, really hate myself for that now. 

So I'm driving home, beating myself up the entire way and trying to figure out how I could see her again. I uploaded photos from the event to facebook and added the girl as a friend so that I could tag her in a couple of them.

I decided to message her, saying I really enjoyed talking to her and would love to continue the conversation, and asked if she wanted to get coffee with me sometime. This still makes me cringe because I feel a facebook message is so impersonal, but it was my fault for not asking for her number earlier and I really didn't know if I'd see her again otherwise. 

Anyways, facebook messaging does that lovely thing where it tells you if the recipient has read your message. Which she did. And I've gotten absolutely no response since then. 

Welp, I chalk it up to disinterest and I leave it be - not gonna make me lose too much sleep over it. Still, I could've taken a hint if she said something like, "Sorry, I'm really busy these days," as opposed to saying nothing at all. 

So now I know as nerve-wracking as asking someone out in person can be, at least I'll get a relatively immediate response instead of this open-ended, waiting for god-knows-how-long bullshit :)
chosen: Note to future self: just grow a pair and ask her out while she's still in front of you. Damn, son.
rejected: I asked a girl out on a date, got no response, now I have to wait for her to reply.

prompt:
If you're reading this, I guess I just wanted to say thanks. I know it's not the juicy drama that is usually really popular here but I've had these feelings eating me up inside for a long time, and it's nice to get them off my chest. Anyway...

All my life, I've felt like I was second place to my brother. My parents are loving people, and my brother has never been nothing but kind and supportive to me, but it always felt like I was in his shadow.

My parents are lovely people, but sometimes I feel like they celebrate my brother in ways that draw a comparison to me. Like when I made a joke about not being able to afford something, and my father quickly replied that my brother made six figures last year. I know the comment wasn't meant to hurt me in any way, but I've had to live with comments like that for a very long time, and it's always stung me pretty hard.

Now, don't get me wrong. My parents are great and my brother is one of my best friends! He's just... better than me at life. He's got a great job, gorgeous fiancée, great house, cool car... While I am struggling to complete my degree and live in a crappy apartment with 3 roommates. 

I don't feel any resentment toward my family or anything like that, even when they compare us. I just have this deep pit of insecurity in my heart. I feel so deeply inadequate and like I've somehow let my family down. Our parents brought us to America in order to let us have a better life, and to be successful. Needless to say... I haven't really been that successful.

Anyway, how do I deal with these feelings of shame and self-hate? And how can I stop comparing myself to my brother in such a self destructive way? It's gotten to the point where I've started avoiding my family like I can somehow hide how much of a disappointment I am and it just makes me feel worse in the end because I start to miss them.
chosen: I feel like I'm a disappointment to my parents. I feel like I'm a worse version of my brother instead of an awesome version of myself. How can I stop feeling this way?
rejected: I feel like I've let my family down and it's causing me to feel like a disappointment to them, and I'm not sure what to do.

prompt:
Well, I don't even know exactly what I expected.  I mean, I had heard that college is supposed to be the optimal time to meet and talk to girls, but it's just not happening for me.  I'm almost half-way through my 2nd year of college, and to say that my love life is barren would be a gross understatement.  I go probably 3-5 days a week without even talking to a girl.  Most of my time is spent doing school work, birding, and hanging out in my dorm.  I just can't grasp how other guys find girls with such ease.  It's not that I'm feeling unhappy; I just have the feeling that there's "something" missing.  

Personality-wise, I'm introverted, somewhat self-centered, and I feel that the way I think about my relationships with others is becoming more analytical than romantic.  So, I think it's fair to say that the number of "suitable" girls for me is lower than for most people.  Therefore, because of my personality, it seems I would have to meet a higher number of girls in order to meet someone I would be interested in, but, ALSO because of my personality, I naturally talk to FEWER girls than most others do.  Perhaps this means I'm simply "destined" for a life of minimal romantic experiences. 

I am already part of a club for people who enjoy nature (one of my greatest passions).  There are several girls in it, but half of them have boyfriends, and I only get to talk to any of them once a week at most anyways.  The one girl that I talk to on a weekly basis is my physics lab partner.  

Maybe I'm asking the impossible by wanting to make the most out of this so-called optimal time in my life, but I just have no idea what to do or where to begin.
chosen: College sucks, meeting girls is practically impossible due to introvert/self-centered personality- wise.  Unsure of what to do or where to begin to improve this situation.
rejected: Half-way through college love life is completely bare, meeting girls is a fruitless exercise due to introverted personality and low number of interested girls.  Wondering where to begin so I can maximize my chances of meeting a girl I'd

prompt:
Hey Reddit. This is a throwaway just because she may or may not know my username.

So we are both almost 17 years old and have been dating for a little over a year now. We are both very much in love with each other and we love each other as well (acknowledging the difference). I'd say we do not fight very often if at all. However, when we do have a confrontation, it is usually because she seems sad about something and I try to ask what's going on. She doesn't talk about anything without me bringing it up. So after gently trying to get her to talk to me about something for a bit, she responds and tells me what is wrong. It is usually simple enough and I am usually at fault for the problem, but the reason she feels sad is because she blames herself.

Other confrontation emerges when I am upset about something and bring it up. I am more forward when there is something I feel is off. Not angry or upset or worked up at all, I just calmly bring it up. When I do this, she usually blames herself completely and apologizes a lot. This makes it hard to talk to her, because often times I am partially at fault. But all she does is apologize and tell me she will be better, and I don't feel like we get anywhere. She isn't brushing it aside, because she doesn't care. She just feels like the problem will improve purely by her own means, and things do not change.

I just really need help with this and could use all I can get.
chosen: Girlfriend of 14 months turns inward and blames herself when I confront her about something wrong. Need help getting her to stop and start being more assertive about confrontation.
rejected: GF turns inward when confronted about anything and apologizes a lot when I do something wrong. How do I get her to stop doing this and start taking responsibility for everything?

prompt:
For anyone interested, here was my original post: 

The comments on that post were very helpful, and I thank you. 

As a followup, I had sent her an email, explaining my feelings which basically were: 

- I like her
- I thought we have potential 
- I can understand / appreciate / respect her desire to take a step back. 

I also gave her an out, just in case that step back was her really wanting to end it, but wanting to be more gentle or nice. 

I asked for clarification on what "not hang out as much as we do" meant to her.

She responded by complementing my thoughtfulness and communication, but suggested that we hang out once a month as friends until she can figure out her feelings. 

Is there anyone who can interpret this for me ? ;) 

On the one hand, I'm glad she didn't take the out. I guess that means she's really still unsure, and thinks there might be some potential.

On the other hand, hanging out once a month as friends makes me sad. 
I definitely don't want to smother her or come off as clingy, but it feels pretty hard to go from hanging out at least a couple of times a week (and having the desire to hang out more and push the relationship forward) to once a month as friends. 

My plan right now is to go ahead with it for a month, maybe two, see if anything changes at all between us. If there are positive signs, great, if not, I might have to move on I think. I can't go 6 months seeing someone I care about only once a month, and treating someone I want to and have kissed as just a friend.
chosen: SO of couple months is taking a step back, but saying she wants to be friends. Can't tell if she really wants to end it. Is this a good idea? Anyone with experience here?
rejected: I'm not confident that my SO is really losing interest in me, but I am definitely not ready to see her as just a friend.

prompt:
When I was 16, I had somehow managed to convince my parents to buy me a bimmer that was a few years old. I loved the shit out of that car, it was absolutely beautiful and way too cool for 16 year old me to have. 

The thing about this car was that it was stick. Now I had never been training in driving manual transition, so I pretty much taught myself how to do it on that car (Horrible Idea)

Fast forward a month: My friends and I had been recruited by the mother of a girl from a local all girls school to be prom dates for her daughter + her friends. We arrived at the girl's house on gameday only to find out that there were 2 too many people for the Limo. I said its alright, I'll drive my own car. So my buddy and I are driving in my car to the location. **This is where dumbness takes over.**

I figured if we were driving separately, we should have some fun by getting a little speed going. Generally when driving stick, people will shift down a gear to get a little speed increase. I decided 1 wasn't enough, and to shift down 2 gears from 5th to 3rd. However, things get dumber. I make the shift.... and end up going from 5th-1st. You never go from 5th to 1st. Cue intense shaking and loud noises and me thinking "WTF WTF WTF WTF".

In the end, I blew out the transition on this newish bimmer I had just received. 

But we made it to the Prom still...
chosen: I blew out of the transmission on my car shifting from 5th-1st by accident.
rejected: fixed a new car, blew it out of the water, and almost didn't make it to the Prom.

prompt:
Hey Reddit,

Sorry if I am posting this in the wrong section, but I have a medical/psychology question. I am a 21 year old who is unable to concentrate on anything. From what I noticed, my lack of concentration comes from an inability to not rush. 

A little backstory. I had an older brother with Dyslexia and another older brother with severe learning disability, although I do not know what in particular. When I was a kid, I could pick up things with relative ease. I hated reading(I have only read three books through and through), but I usually followed my gut and, for the most part, got through it. History was by far the easiest, I assume because I could just remember the lectures. Math and English were drags but I always placed mid 70's, which was good enough for me at the time. 

I never really had an issue until I began working a steady job, which called for me to take the occasional phone number from time to time. I would mix up numbers 90% of the time. I never really thought much of it, as I sucked with numbers. Then I wanted to learn more about my trade, design/web development, and realized I can not retain anything. I have read the same chapter about an HTML5 Document several times, but can't remember a damn thing.

I am not really looking for a diagnoses or validation, I am more looking for anything to help me. White noise worked one day a few months back, however all other attempt have been futile. Any one have any advice?
chosen: I am 21 and have no concentration. Looking for anything that can help me. Any tips?
rejected: I can't focus and am unable to retain information. I want to attempt to change this by working on it.
